{{TOC right}}
==Cities== * [[Mercer Human Resource Consulting]]: [[List of most expensive cities for expatriate employees|Most expensive cities]] 2017, [[Dhaka]] ranked 160
==Communications== {{main|Communications in Bangladesh}} * [[The World Factbook]]: [[List of countries by number of mobile phones in use|number of mobile phones in use]] ranked 10 * [[OECD]]: [[List of countries by number of broadband Internet users|number of broadband Internet users]] ranked 66th <ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.oecd.org/document/60/0,3343,en_2649_201185_39574076_1_1_1_1,00.html | title=Broadband Internet users | publisher=[[OECD]] }}</ref> * [[Economist Intelligence Unit]]: [[e-readiness]] 2008 ranked out of 70 countries<ref>{{cite web | url=http://a330.g.akamai.net/7/330/25828/20080331202303/graphics.eiu.com/upload/ibm_ereadiness_2008.pdf | title= e-readiness 2008 | publisher= [[Economist Intelligence Unit]] }}</ref>
==Demographics== {{main|Demographics of Bangladesh}} * United Nations: [[List of countries by population|Population]] ranked 8 out of 221 countries and dependencies * [[List of countries and dependencies by population density|Population density]] ranked 5 most densely populated country, ranked 9 out of all countries and dependencies * United Nations report World Population Policies 2005, [[List of countries by immigrant population|Number of immigrants]] ranked 36 out of 192 countries
==Economy== {{main|Economy of Bangladesh}} [[File:Bashundhara city.jpg|thumb|160px|right|[[Bashundhara City]], the largest shopping mall in South Asia]] * United Nations: [[List of countries by Human Development Index|Human Development Index]], ranked 139 out of 188 countries * [[List of countries by GDP (nominal) growth rate|Nominal GDP growth rate]] 2016: ranked 10 out of 218 countries * [[List of countries by GDP (nominal)|Nominal GDP]]: ranked 43 by the [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]]; ranked 43 by the [[World Bank]]; ranked 56 by the [[CIA World Factbook|CIA]] * [[List of countries by GDP (nominal) per capita|Nominal GDP per capita]] 2006, ranked 144 out of 187 by [[International Monetary Fund|IMF]]; ranked 141 out of 178 by [[World Bank]]; ranked 159 out of 195 by [[CIA World Factbook|CIA]] * [[The Heritage Foundation]] and [[The Wall Street Journal]]: [[Index of Economic Freedom]] 2010, ranked 137 out of 179 countries<ref>[http://www.heritage.org/index/Ranking.aspx 2010 Index of Economic Freedom World Rankings]</ref> * [[The Economist]]: [[Where-to-be-born Index]] 2013, ranked 77 out of 80<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Kekic |first=Laza |date=21 November 2012 |title=The lottery of life |url=http://www.economist.com/media/pdf/QUALITY_OF_LIFE.pdf |magazine=The Economist}}</ref> * [[World Economic Forum]]: [[Global Competitiveness Index]] 2009–2010, ranked 106 out of 133 countries<ref>[http://www.weforum.org/pdf/GCR09/GCR20092010fullrankings.pdf The Global Competitiveness Index 2009–2010 rankings] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101030003958/http://www.weforum.org/pdf/GCR09/GCR20092010fullrankings.pdf |date=30 October 2010 }} PDF</ref> * [[World Economic Forum]]: [[Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Report]] 2009, ranked 129 out of 133 countries<ref>[http://www.weforum.org/pdf/TTCR09/TTCR09_Rankings.pdf Travel & Tourism Competitiveness Index 2009] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091001161559/http://www.weforum.org/pdf/TTCR09/TTCR09_Rankings.pdf |date=1 October 2009 }} PDF</ref> * Labor Force: ranked 8 (2010 est.)<ref name="CIA World Factbook: Bangladesh">[https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/bg.html CIA World Factbook: Bangladesh]</ref> * [[List of countries by FDI abroad|Foreign direct investment]] (FDI) abroad: ranked 75 (2009 est.) * [[List of countries by received FDI|Foreign direct investment]] (FDI) received: ranked 79 (2009 est.)
==Education== {{main|Education in Bangladesh}} * [[United Nations Development Programme]]: [[List of countries by literacy rate|literacy rate]] 2014, ranked 34 out of 177 <ref>[http://hdr.undp.org/en/media/HDR_2009_EN_Complete.pdf United Nations Development Programme Report 2009] PDF</ref>
==Energy== * [[The World Factbook]]: [[List of countries by oil imports|oil imports]] 2006, ranked 71 out of 206 countries * [[The World Factbook]]: [[List of countries by oil consumption|oil consumption]] 2006, 75 ranked out of 208 countries * Proved Natural Gas Production: ranked 32 (2010 est.)<ref name="CIA World Factbook: Bangladesh"/> * Proved Natural Gas Reserves: ranked 52 (2009 est.)<ref name="CIA World Factbook: Bangladesh"/> * [[List of countries by electricity consumption|Electricity Consumption]]: ranked 65 * [[List of countries by electricity production|Electricity Production]]: ranked 65
==Environment== * [[Yale University]] Center for Environmental Law and Policy and [[Columbia University]] Center for International Earth Science Information Network: [[Environmental Sustainability Index]], ranked out of 145 countries<ref>[http://www.yale.edu/esi/ESI2005_Main_Report.pdf Environmental Sustainability Index] {{webarchive|url=https://www.webcitation.org/616iL4skY?url=http://www.yale.edu/esi/ESI2005_Main_Report.pdf |date=21 August 2011 }} PDF</ref> * [[US Department of Energy]]: [[List of countries by carbon dioxide emissions per capita|CO² emissions per capita]] 2004, ranked out of 206 countries<ref>[http://mdgs.un.org/unsd/mdg/Data.aspx United Nations Millennium Development Goals Indicators]</ref> * [[The World Factbook]]: [[List of countries by total renewable water resources|water resources]] ranked out of 174 countries<ref>[https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/fields/2201.html World Factbook 2201] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150612123716/https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/fields/2201.html |date=12 June 2015 }}</ref>
==Geography== {{Main|Geography of Bangladesh}} [[File:Satellite image of Bangladesh in October 2001.jpg|thumb|right|Satellite image showing physical features of Bangladesh]] * [[List of countries and outlying territories by total area|Total area]] ranked 90 * [[List of countries by total renewable water resources|Total renewable water resources]] ranked 12
==Globalization== {{see also|Globalization}} * KOF: [[Index of Globalization]] 2007, ranked 112 out of 122 countries<ref>[http://globalization.kof.ethz.ch/static/pdf/rankings_2007.pdf KOF Index of Globalization 2007] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090304173652/http://globalization.kof.ethz.ch/static/pdf/rankings_2007.pdf |date=4 March 2009 }} PDF</ref> * [[A.T. Kearney]]/[[Foreign Policy Magazine]]: [[Globalization Index]] 2006, ranked 58 out of 62 countries<ref>[http://www.atkearney.com/shared_res/pdf/Globalization-Index_FP_Nov-Dec-06_S.pdf Globalization Index 2006] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080306223527/http://www.atkearney.com/shared_res/pdf/Globalization-Index_FP_Nov-Dec-06_S.pdf |date=6 March 2008 }} PDF</ref>
==Industry== * [[Organisation Internationale des Constructeurs d'Automobiles|OICA]] [[List of countries by automobile production|automobile production]] 2007, ranked out of 51 countries<ref>[http://oica.net/wp-content/uploads/all-vehicles.pdf OICA] (PDF)</ref>
==Military== {{main|Military of Bangladesh}} * [[Center for Strategic and International Studies]]: [[List of countries by number of active troops|active troops]] 100 ranked out of 166 countries<ref>[http://www.csis.org/media/csis/pubs/060626_asia_balance_powers.pdf Asia balance of power] (PDF)</ref>
==Politics== {{main|Politics of Bangladesh}} [[File:Bangladesh divisions english.svg|thumb|right|Bangladesh's seven administrative divisions: [[Barisal Division|Barisal]] (বরিশাল), [[Chittagong Division|Chittagong]] (চট্টগ্রাম), [[Dhaka Division|Dhaka]] (ঢাকা), [[Khulna Division|Khulna]] (খুলনা), [[Rangpur Division|Rangpur]] (রংপুর), [[Rajshahi Division|Rajshahi]] (রাজশাহী), and [[Sylhet Division|Sylhet]] (সিলেট)<ref name="CIA2007">[https://www.cia.gov/library/publications/the-world-factbook/geos/bg.html CIA World Factbook]</ref>]] * [[Transparency International]]: [[Corruption Perceptions Index]],ranked 134 out of 178 countries (2010 est) * [[Reporters without borders]]: [[Reporters without borders#Worldwide Press Freedom Index|Worldwide press freedom index]], ranked 126 out of 167 countries * [[The Economist]] [[Democracy Index]] 2007, ranked 83 out of 167 countries (2010 est)
==Society== {{main|Culture of Bangladesh}} * [[Save the Children]]: [[Save the Children State of the World's Mothers report|State of the World's Mothers report]] 2006, ranked out of 110 countries * [[World Health Organization]]: [[List of countries by suicide rate|Suicide rate]] ranked out of 100 countries
==Technology== * [[Brown University]] Taubman Center for Public Policy 2006: ranked 86 in online government services<ref name="Taubman">{{cite news | url= http://english.hani.co.kr/arti/english_edition/e_international/154299.html | title= S. Korea rated No. 1 in e-government rankings | publisher= [[The Hankyoreh]] | date= 4 September 2006 }}</ref><ref name="Global e-Government">{{cite web | url= http://www.brown.edu/Administration/News_Bureau/2006-07/06-007.html | title= Sixth Annual Global e-Government Study | publisher=[[Brown University]] Taubman Center for Public Policy | date= 1 August 2006 }}</ref>
==References== {{reflist|2}}
{{Bangladesh topics}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:International Rankings Of Bangladesh}} [[Category:International rankings by country|Bangladesh]] [[Category:Bangladesh-related lists|*]]

revision.comment: Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.1)
revision.text:
{{Infobox oil field | name = Kurmangazy oil field | image = | caption = | location_map = Caspian Sea | location_map_width = | location_map_text = | relief = | coordinates = | coordinates_ref = | country = [[Kazakhstan]] | region = [[Caspian Sea]] | location = | block = | offonshore = Offshore | operators = Kurmangazy Petroleum Company | partners = [[KazMunayGas]]
[[Rosneft]] | contractors = | discovery = | start_development = | start_production = | peak_year = | abandonment = | peak_of_production_oil_bbl/d = | peak_of_production_oil_tpy = | peak_of_production_gas_mmcuft/d = | peak_of_production_gas_mmscm/d = | peak_of_production_gas_bcm/y = | oil_production_bbl/d = | oil_production_tpy = | production_year_oil = | production_gas_mmcuft/d = | production_gas_mmscm/d = | production_gas_bcm/y = | production_year_gas = | est_oil_bbl = 7000 | est_oil_t = | recover_oil_bbl = | recover_oil_t = | est_gas_bft = | est_gas_bcm = | recover_gas_bft = | recover_gas_bcm = | formations = }} The '''Kurmangazy oil field''' is an offshore oil field located in the Kazakh section of the [[Caspian Sea]] on the maritime border between [[Russia]] and [[Kazakhstan]], about {{convert|120|km|mi|-1}} west of the [[Buzachi Peninsula]]. It is expected to be the third largest oil field of Kazakhstan. {{cite news | url = http://silkroadintelligencer.com/2007/10/31/kurmungazy-a-risky-proposition-that-does-not-draw/ | title = Kurmangazy: A Risky Proposition | publisher = Silk Road Intelligencer | date = 2007-10-31 | accessdate = 2009-10-17}} The field is named after [[Kurmangazy Sagyrbayuly]]. ==History== The first agreement concerning Kurmangazy field was signed in 2002. The US$23 billion worth PSA agreement was signed with [[KazMunayGas]] and [[Rosneft]] on 6 June 2005. In May 2006, the first well was drilled into the structure; however, it failed to strike oil. ==Reserves== The oil field has estimated reserves of {{convert|7|to|10|Goilbbl|e9m3|abbr=off}}. ==Operator== The field is operated by Kurmangazy Petroleum Company. KazMunayTeniz, a subsidiary of KazMunayGas, owns 50% of the project and RN – Kazakhstan LLС, a subsidiary of Rosneft, owns 25%. Originally, 25% of shares was assigned to [[Zarubezhneft]], but later Rosneft received the option on this remaining stake once commercial extraction commences. {{cite news | url = http://www.gasandoil.com/GOC/company/cnc40863.htm | title = Kazakhstan wants to sell 25 % of Kurmangazy to Total | publisher = Alexander's Gas & Oil Connections | date = 2004-02-05 | accessdate = 2009-10-17}} [[Total S.A.]] and [[ONGC]] have shown interest to join the project. {{cite news | url = http://www.hinduonnet.com/thehindu/2004/11/14/stories/2004111405920100.htm | title = India, Russia plan big oil-gas deals | author = Amit Baruah | publisher = [[The Hindu]] | date = 2004-11-14 | accessdate = 2009-10-17}} ==See also== {{Portal|Kazakhstan|Energy}} * [[Energy in Kazakhstan]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20090601233250/http://www.rosneft.com/Upstream/Exploration/international/kurmangazy_kazakhstan/ Kurmangazy Structure (Rosneft's website)] * [http://www.kmg.kz/page.php?page_id=1246&lang=2 Kurmangazy (KazMunayGas' website)] {{coord missing|Kazakhstan}} {{Resources in Kazakhstan}} [[Category:Oil fields of Kazakhstan]] [[Category:Geography of Kazakhstan]] [[Category:Caspian Sea]] [[Category:Rosneft]]

page.title: List of Are You Being Served? episodes

revision.text:
{{Use British English|date=October 2016}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{refimprove|date=May 2012}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:List of ''Are You Being Served?'' episodes}} The following is a list of episodes for the [[British sitcom]] ''[[Are You Being Served?]]'' that aired from 1972 to 1985. All episodes were 30 minutes long. There was a film in 1977, also entitled ''[[Are You Being Served? (film)|Are You Being Served?]]''. While all episodes were in colour, the pilot had originally survived only in [[black-and-white]] as a film transfer from the original colour source; however, it was restored into colour using the [[chroma dots]] computer colour restoration technique and was aired on [[BBC Two]] on 1 January 2010.<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00pmbmn |title=Two Programmes – Are You Being Served?, Pilot |publisher=BBC |date=1 January 2010 |accessdate=12 August 2010}}</ref>
==Series overview== <onlyinclude> <!--Full linking is used for transclusion to main article--> {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; width:60%;" |- !colspan=2 rowspan=2|Series !rowspan=2|Episodes !colspan=2|Originally aired<!--UK--> |- !First aired !Last aired |- | style="background:#FFDEAD;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Pilot (1972)|Pilot]] | 1 |colspan="2"| 8 September 1972 |- | style="background:#FFD1DC;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 1 (1973)|Series 1]] | 5 | 21 March 1973 | 18 April 1973 |- | style="background:#73C2FB;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 2 (1974)|Series 2]] | 5 | 14 March 1974 | 11 April 1974 |- | style="background:#50C878;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 3 (1975)|Series 3]] | 8 | 27 February 1975 | 17 April 1975 |- | style="background:#00FF00;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Christmas special (1975)|Special (1975)]] | 1 |colspan="2"| 22 December 1975 |- | style="background:#D861FF;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 4 (1976)|Series 4]] | 6 | 8 April 1976 | 12 May 1976 |- | style="background:#00FF00;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Christmas special (1976)|Special (1976)]] | 1 |colspan="2"| 24 December 1976 |- | style="background:#ED9121;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 5 (1977)|Series 5]] | 7 | 25 February 1977 | 8 April 1977 |- | style="background:#00AC53;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 6 (1978)|Series 6]] | 5 | 15 November 1978 | 13 December 1978 |- | style="background:#00FF00;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Christmas special (1978)|Special (1978)]] | 1 |colspan="2"| 26 December 1978 |- | style="background:#F984E5;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 7 (1979)|Series 7]] | 7 | 19 October 1979 | 30 November 1979 |- | style="background:#00FF00;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Christmas special (1979)|Special (1979)]] | 1 |colspan="2"| 26 December 1979 |- | style="background:#01645C;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 8 (1981)|Series 8]] | 7 | 9 April 1981 | 28 May 1981 |- | style="background:#00FF00;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Christmas special (1981)|Special (1981)]] | 1 |colspan="2"| 24 December 1981 |- | style="background:#FB6900;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 9 (1983)|Series 9]] | 6 | 22 April 1983 | 27 May 1983 |- | style="background:#B77FDF;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Series 10 (1985)|Series 10]] | 7 | 18 February 1985 | 1 April 1985 |- | style="background:#73C2FB;"| | [[List of Are You Being Served? episodes#Special (2016)|Special (2016)]] | 1 |colspan="2"| 28 August 2016 |- |} </onlyinclude>
All ten series, including both the black & white and colour versions of the pilot episode and all five Christmas specials from those years, are now available on DVD in the UK (Region 2). ''Are You Being Served: the Movie'' was released in 2002. The complete series of [[Grace & Favour]] was released in 2016.
All ten series, as well as both series of Grace & Favour (in packaging titled ''Are You Being Served? Again!'') and the film are available on DVD in Region 1 (North America).
All ten series, as well as both series of ''Grace & Favour'' (under the original title) and the film have been released in Australia (Region 4).
''Are You Being Served? – Best of The Early Years'' and ''Are You Being Served? Christmas Specials'' DVDs have also been released.
Also see [[List of Are You Being Served? characters]].
==Episodes==
===Pilot (1972)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#FFDEAD |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 1 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = Are You Being Served? | DirectedBy = [[Bernard Thompson (director)|Bernard Thompson]] | WrittenBy = [[David Croft (TV producer)|David Croft]] & [[Jeremy Lloyd]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1972|9|8|df=y}} | ShortSummary = A reorganisation within the store forces the staff of the Gentlemen's Ready-To-Wear Department to share their floor space with the Ladies Department. Mrs. Slocombe, head of the Ladies, and Mr Grainger, head of the Gents, immediately come to loggerheads over control of the centre floor display. Mr Grainger refuses to take down his trousers and put Mrs Slocombe's underwear in its place. Undaunted, she goes over his head to Captain Peacock, and then to Mr Rumbold. Guest starring [[Michael Knowles (actor)|Michael Knowles]] as the customer looking for the Gents.
Filmed: May 1972
'''Note:''' This episode was broadcast as a part of ''[[Comedy Playhouse]]''. | LineColor = FFDEAD }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 1 (1973)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#FFD1DC |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 2 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = Dear Sexy Knickers... | DirectedBy = Bernard Thompson | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1973|3|21|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr Lucas tries to salvage his bad day at work by sending a love note to Miss Brahms, whom he addresses as "Sexy Knickers," asking her to meet him after work. His attempt to deliver the note to Miss Brahms is unsuccessful, and when he tries to retrieve it, he is thwarted by Captain Peacock. Peacock intercepts the note and hands it to Mrs Slocombe unread, setting off a succession of misunderstandings.
Filmed: 16 February 1973 | LineColor = FFD1DC }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 3 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = Our Figures Are Slipping | DirectedBy = Bernard Thompson | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1973|3|28|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Sales figures for the department are falling, and Mr Rumbold insists the staff stay behind after the store closes to learn about sales technique. Mr Rumbold suggests that Mr Lucas "smile more" in an effort to help boost his sales figures, but the junior's half-hearted implementation seems to have the opposite effect.
Filmed: 23 February 1973 | LineColor = FFD1DC }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 4 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = Camping In | DirectedBy = Bernard Thompson | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1973|4|4|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Owing to a transport [[Strike action|strike]], the staff are forced to stay in the store overnight. Mr Rumbold arranges for the staff to sleep in tents—much to the rest of the staff's displeasure. Invaders in Miss Brahms's tent, Mr Grainger leaving his flap open and Captain Peacock wanting to share Mr Rumbold's bed all add to the hilarity of sleeping with colleagues. Guest starring [[Colin Bean]] as the leatherette gloves customer and [[Pamela Manson]] as the hat customer.
Filmed: 2 March 1973 | LineColor = FFD1DC }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 5 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = His and Hers | DirectedBy = Bernard Thompson | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1973|4|11|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The sales staff are upset when Grace Brothers hires an attractive outside saleswoman, Miss French ([[Joanna Lumley]]), to demonstrate a new unisex line of [[perfume]], "His and Hers". Sales of the perfume cut into the staff's commissions, and when they discover that the saleswoman is giving away freebies with every purchase, the staff come together and successfully sabotage the perfume stand. The saleswoman quits, but the staff learn that they have actually bitten the hand that feeds them and must now sell the perfume themselves.
Filmed:10 March 1973 | LineColor = FFD1DC }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 6 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = Diamonds Are a Man's Best Friend | DirectedBy = Bernard Thompson | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1973|4|18|df=y}} | ShortSummary = On the day they get their meagre wages, the staff search frantically for a [[diamond]] lost in the store by a customer who is offering a £100 reward for its return. Though they initially all agree to split the reward between them should any one of them find the diamond, greed washes over everyone and, when each believes they have found the missing stone, plots to cheat one another out of the reward money are hatched. Guest starring [[Janet Davies (actress)|Janet Davies]] and [[Elizabeth Larner]]. Filmed: 17 March 1973 | LineColor = FFD1DC }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 2 (1974)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#73C2FB |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 7 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = The Clock | DirectedBy = [[Harold Snoad]] | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1974|3|14|df=y}} | ShortSummary = As Mr. Grainger celebrates his 65th birthday, all the staff wonder whether he'll get the traditional [[cuckoo clock]] that means he is being retired. In the evening, the staff and Mrs. Grainger have dinner and Mr. Rumbold tells Captain Peacock that Grainger is being given the cuckoo clock. However, Young Mr. Grace makes a late appearance and gives the clock to himself and gives Mr. Grainger another five years. Guest starring [[John Ringham]].
Filmed: 3 March 1974 | LineColor = 73C2FB }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 8 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = Cold Comfort | DirectedBy = Harold Snoad | WrittenBy = David Croft, Jeremy Lloyd & [[Michael Knowles (actor)|Michael Knowles]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1974|3|21|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Owing to [[fuel]] shortages, Grace Brothers' [[central heating]] is turned off during bitterly cold weather. While Mr. Rumbold secretly uses an [[Electric heating|electric fire]], the floor staff use other methods to keep themselves warm until Captain Peacock finds out and takes all the devices to Mr. Rumbold's office. In an attempt to hide the electric fire, Mr. Rumbold's office is set on fire. It is put out by Mr. Lucas.
Filmed: 10 March 1974 | LineColor = 73C2FB }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 9 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = The Think Tank | DirectedBy = Harold Snoad | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1974|3|28|df=y}} | ShortSummary = After being down by £600 last week, Mr. Rumbold forms a "[[think tank]]" to come up with ways to increase sales. Captain Peacock suggests a [[Fashion design|fashion show]], for which Mr. Rumbold then takes the credit. When this is performed, with the staff as the [[model (person)|models]], in front of Young Mr. Grace, he doesn't like it and suggests a sale.
Filmed: 17 March 1974 | LineColor = 73C2FB }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 10 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = Big Brother | DirectedBy = Harold Snoad | WrittenBy = David Croft, Jeremy Lloyd & Michael Knowles | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1974|4|4|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Shoplifting is on the increase, so Mr. Rumbold decides to get [[Closed-circuit television|CCTV]] installed and recruits Mr. Clegg, formerly of [[Criminal Investigation Department|CID]], who searches the staff as they leave. Using the CCTV from his office, Rumbold can watch everyone, and he soon catches all the staff doing things they shouldn't. After being confronted, the staff come up with a plan to make Mr. Rumbold get rid of the cameras.
Filmed: 24 March 1974 | LineColor = 73C2FB }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 11 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = Hoorah for the Holidays | DirectedBy = Harold Snoad | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1974|4|11|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Young Mr. Grace decides to have the whole store redecorated and will close the shop for two weeks in August. The management hopes the staff will take their holidays during this time and offers them £5 "inconvenience money". When the staff refuse this, Young Mr. Grace offers them a choice of destinations which he will pay for them to go to. The choices, however, leave a lot to be desired. Guest starring [[John Clegg (actor)|John Clegg]].
Filmed: 31 March 1974 | LineColor = 73C2FB }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 3 (1975)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#50C878 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 12 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = The Hand of Fate | DirectedBy = David Croft | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|2|27|df=y}} | ShortSummary = One of the directors is retiring from the Board due to ill health, and Mr. Rumbold is being considered for the position. If he gets the position, Captain Peacock will take over from him, and Mr. Grainger and Mrs. Slocombe both want to replace Peacock. Meanwhile, Mr. Humphries reveals he can [[Chiromancy|read palms]] and when he reads Captain Peacock's it leads the staff to believe he and Rumbold will both be promoted, while Mrs. Slocombe's palm says she will have a man at her feet.
Filmed: Autumn 1974 | LineColor = 50C878 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 13 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = Coffee Morning | DirectedBy = David Croft | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|3|6|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Following Mr. Grainger being late from his coffee break, Mr. Rumbold and Captain Peacock institute a book that must be signed and timed when people take their tea or coffee break or go to the toilet. The other staff then agree to refuse to sign it, and when Mr. Grainger becomes the first person to refuse he is fined 25 pence. Mr. Rumbold also docks Mr. Grainger 25 pence for lost work for being late. Mr. Mash then calls a "go slow" to make the management give in to their demands. | LineColor = 50C878 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 14 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = Up Captain Peacock | DirectedBy = David Croft | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|3|13|df=y}} | ShortSummary = As a reward for being at Grace Brothers for 20 years, Captain Peacock is given the key to the executive lavatory and access to the executive dining room, both of which annoy Mr. Grainger in particular. Meanwhile, the whole floor is annoyed when their lunch hour is delayed by one hour until 2pm and Mr. Grainger thinks about ringing the [[Factories Act 1961|Factory Inspector]]. Guest starring [[Donald Hewlett]], [[Michael Knowles (actor)|Michael Knowles]], and [[Jeffrey Segal]]. | LineColor = 50C878 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 15 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = Cold Store | DirectedBy = David Croft | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|3|20|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr. Lucas has a girl coming to visit him, so he tries to pretend he has a [[Common cold|cold]] to get the day off work. Captain Peacock gets Sister (played by [[Joy Allen]]) to check his temperature, which says he is perfectly normal. However, Mrs. Slocombe does have a cold, but refuses to go home. Miss Brahms, who has an [[Injection (medicine)|injection]] to prevent her getting a cold, refuses to work with her. Captain Peacock then decides that the solution is that Mr. Lucas work with Mrs. Slocombe for the day, but he still tries to get sent home sick by falling down the stairs aided by Mr. Mash. Guest starring [[Pamela Cundell]] and [[Gordon Peters]]. | LineColor = 50C878 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 16 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = Wedding Bells | DirectedBy = David Croft | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|3|27|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mrs. Slocombe argues with Captain Peacock and Mr. Rumbold when she refuses to sell certain items. Young Mr. Grace announces to the department that he intends to ask someone in Grace Brothers to marry him, having been a widower for 40 years. He then invites Mrs. Slocombe for [[Tea (meal)|tea]], and the staff think he is going to ask her to marry him. However, he merely wants her advice on whether to ask Miss Robinson, of the Jewellery Department, and by accident puts him off marriage completely. Guest starring [[John Clegg (actor)|John Clegg]]. | LineColor = 50C878 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 17 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | Title = German Week | DirectedBy = David Croft | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|4|3|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Young Mr. Grace decides to have a "German Week" where the department will sell only [[Germany|German]] goods. However, after two days they discover they have only made 64 pence, so Mr. Rumbold and the floor staff decide to give the department a more German feel by dressing up and serving [[German wine]]. Guest starring [[Joanna Lumley]]. | LineColor = 50C878 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 18 | EpisodeNumber2 = 7 | Title = Shoulder to Shoulder | DirectedBy = [[Ray Butt]] | WrittenBy = David Croft, Jeremy Lloyd & Michael Knowles | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|4|10|df=y}} | ShortSummary = When Young Mr. Grace decides that he can only afford to have half of the department decorated, the Ladies' Wear Department is forced to temporarily relocate to Menswear while the work is carried out, and friction ensues over how much display space Mrs. Slocombe should be allowed. | LineColor = 50C878 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 19 | EpisodeNumber2 = 8 | Title = New Look | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft, Jeremy Lloyd & Michael Knowles | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|4|17|df=y}} | ShortSummary = At an after-hours meeting, the staff open the department's Suggestion Box, only to find that there are no useful suggestions. They then decide that background music and a recorded store-wide voiceover will boost sales. When cash is offered to do the voiceover, all the floor staff want the recorded voice to be theirs. Unfortunately, Young Mr. Grace concludes that the only voice he likes is his own. Guest starring [[Felix Bowness]]. | LineColor = 50C878 }} }}</onlyinclude>
====Christmas special (1975)==== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#00FF00 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 20 | EpisodeNumber2 = 9 | Title = Christmas Crackers | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = [[John Chapman (English writer)|John T. Chapman]] & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1975|12|22|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The staff are called to an early morning meeting to decide on ways to boost [[Christmas]] sales figures. However, Young Mr. Grace has already decided that all the floor staff will have to wear novelty costumes, something which none of them are too happy about.
Filmed: November 1975
'''First appearance of [[Doremy Vernon]] as The Canteen Manageress''' '''Last appearance of Mr. Mash''' | LineColor = 00FF00 }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 4 (1976)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#D861FF |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 21 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = No Sale | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1976|4|8|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Grace Brothers decide to open at 8.30am in order to attract customers on their way to work. The idea is a great success with takings up, but by the afternoon the floor staff decide to make sure takings are the same as the Monday before to avoid having to come to work at 8.30 every day, so they try to put people off buying things. Guest starring Reg Dixon and [[Gordon Peters]].
Filmed: 2 April 1976 | LineColor = D861FF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 22 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = Top Hat and Tails | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1976|4|15|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Young Mr. Grace wants the Ladies' and Men's Wear department to form a ballroom dancing team to enter the national Golden Shoes Competition, and when a financial reward is offered all the staff are happy to take part. During rehearsals, Young Mr. Grace watches them to decide whether they are good enough.
Filmed: 9 April 1976
'''First appearance of Mr. Harman''' | LineColor = D861FF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 23 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = Forward Mr. Grainger | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1976|4|22|df=y}} | ShortSummary = When Mr. Rumbold goes to [[Swansea]] for a month-long sales seminar, Mr. Grainger is placed in charge, much to Captain Peacock's annoyance. Mr. Grainger soon makes himself very unpopular because of the way he runs the department. However, very soon Mr. Rumbold comes back as the [[hotel]] in Swansea has [[flood]]ed and everyone ignores Mr. Grainger.
Filmed: 16 April 1976 | LineColor = D861FF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 24 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = Fire Practice | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1976|4|29|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Young Mr. Grace warns Mr. Rumbold that there will be a fire drill but refuses to tell him at what time. Meanwhile, an [[Arab]] [[Emir]] arrives in the department wishing to buy a pair of trousers for one of his wives, but no one is allowed to touch her, so measuring her proves difficult. While they are completing the sale, the fire alarm goes off and the staff response means they all have to stay behind that evening and practise what to do if there is a fire.
Filmed: 23 April 1976 | LineColor = D861FF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 25 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = Fifty Years On | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1976|5|5|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mrs. Slocombe reminds everyone that her birthday is approaching, and the rest of the staff work out that she will be 50. They then buy her a present and practise singing "[[Happy Birthday to You|Happy Birthday]]", and Mr. Humphries has a special cake made. However, when the cake is revealed and it says "50" Mrs. Slocombe is horrified. Mr. Harman also unveils the "If you want to get a head get a hat" promotional mannequin which only works properly when the "Flexi-Girdle Corporation" display works. Guest starring [[Tony Sympson]] and [[Mavis Pugh]].
Filmed: 30 April 1976 | LineColor = D861FF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 26 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | Title = Oh What a Tangled Web | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1976|5|12|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Both Captain Peacock and Mr. Rumbold's secretary Miss Hazelwood are late, and it is rumoured that they are having an affair. It is revealed that the staff have suspected them of having an affair since the Christmas party. Mrs. Peacock (played by [[Diana King (actress)|Diana King]]) arrives at the store, as does Miss Hazelwood's father, and an inquiry has to be held after both Mrs. Slocombe and Mr. Grainger are attacked due to several misunderstandings and Captain Peacock explains what happened between him and Miss Hazelwood.
Filmed: 7 May 1976 | LineColor = D861FF }} }}</onlyinclude>
====Christmas special (1976)==== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#00FF00 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 27 | EpisodeNumber2 = 7 | Title = The Father Christmas Affair | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1976|12|24|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Grace Brothers decides to have electric [[Father Christmas]] models, but this is soon cancelled when they go wrong. Young Mr. Grace then decides to offer £50 to a member of the department, including Mr. Rumbold, to dress up as Father Christmas and give gifts to the children. Young Mr. Grace gets a young boy to decide which one of the staff will be Father Christmas. Meanwhile, Mr. Grainger is worried about his annual performance to entertain the residents of an old people's home.
Filmed: 6 December 1976 | LineColor = 00FF00 }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 5 (1977)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#ED9121 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 28 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = Mrs. Slocombe Expects | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1977|2|25|df=y}} | ShortSummary = When the male staff hear Mrs. Slocombe talking to Miss Brahms about a "happy event", they think that Mrs. Slocombe is pregnant. However, it turns out that it is her cat that is expecting, and Mrs. Slocombe asks Mr. Rumbold if the cat can give birth in the fitting room so she can be near it. When he refuses, Mr. Harman smuggles it in. Meanwhile, Young Mr. Grace tries to show the staff how to improve sales.
Filmed: 24 February 1977 | LineColor = ED9121 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 29 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = A Change Is as Good as a Rest | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1977|3|4|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The floor staff are summoned to the Board Room, and while they wait for Mr. Rumbold and Young Mr. Grace they look in the file on the table which says they are all to be replaced. In protest they decide to resign and Mr. Grainger does so first. However, they are then told that all the staff are merely changing departments for a week. Mr. Grainger asks for his job back, but Mr. Humphries and Mr. Lucas have already been promoted, so he is made Junior Assistant. Later, the staff are moved to the Toy Department for the week and Mr. Rumbold tries to get Mr. Grainger his old job back.
Filmed: 3 March 1977 | LineColor = ED9121 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 30 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = Founder's Day | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1977|3|11|df=y}} | ShortSummary = To celebrate Young Mr. Grace's 80th birthday, the staff plan a ''This Is Your Department'', a spoof of ''[[This Is Your Life (UK TV series)|This Is Your Life]]'', using Young Mr. Grace's memoirs to show how he has affected all of their lives. Meanwhile, Mrs. Slocombe and Miss Brahms argue when a customer (played by [[Tim Barrett (actor)|Tim Barrett]]) wants to buy two [[Fur clothing|fur coats]], one for his wife and one for his girlfriend.
Filmed: 10 March 1977 | LineColor = ED9121 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 31 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = The Old Order Changes | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1977|3|18|df=y}} | ShortSummary = After visiting the United States, Young Mr. Grace decides on the new idea of American informality in the hope of increasing sales. This includes all the staff calling each other by their first names, dressing in their own clothes and background music. However, after a week or so Young Mr. Grace returns from [[China]] and has [[Quotations from Chairman Mao Zedong|a new set of ideas]]. Guest starring [[Jeffrey Holland]] and [[Bernice Adams]].
Filmed: 17 March 1977 | LineColor = ED9121 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 32 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = Take-over | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1977|3|25|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Having been told a rival store is attempting a take-over of Grace Brothers, the staff soon worry for their jobs. Mr. Rumbold then comes up with a plan to make sure the take-over is voted against at a Shareholders' Dinner, and when money is offered all the staff volunteer to dress up as sympathetic shareholders who can't get to the dinner. Mr. Harman and Mrs. Slocombe dress up as Lord and Lady Stableforth, with Miss Brahms as their daughter Lavinia and Mr. Grainger as Sir Richard Ryan. Meanwhile, when the chef and waiters can't get there, Mr. Humphries is forced to stand in as chef with Mr. Lucas and Captain Peacock as the waiters. Guest starring [[Mavis Pugh]].
Filmed: 24 March 1977 | LineColor = ED9121 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 33 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | Title = Goodbye Mr. Grainger | DirectedBy = Ray Butt | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1977|4|1|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr. Grainger has become increasingly bad-tempered, something which is not helped by his losing the centre display stand to Mrs. Slocombe for "bra week". The rest of the staff agree that he has to go, and when Mr. Harman tells Mr. Grainger of their decision he resigns first. However, the following day he comes in and apologises for his bad mood. The reason for the change of mood becomes clear when he tells them he has won [[Football pools|the pools]]. He showers his co-workers with gifts and his resignation letter reaches Mr. Grace's office, but Mr. Humphries speaks to the pools firm and discovers that Mr. Grainger has not won anything. Surprisingly, Mr. Grainger is not totally disappointed, and he decides to stay on. And then, his unopened resignation letter is revealed, with interesting results.
Filmed: 31 March 1977 | LineColor = ED9121 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 34 | EpisodeNumber2 = 7 | Title = It Pays to Advertise | DirectedBy = [[Bob Spiers]] | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1977|4|8|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Grace Brothers decide to make an advert, set in a cocktail bar, to increase sales. This is filmed in the department using the staff as actors and with Mr. Humphries as the director. Meanwhile, Mr. Humphries and Mrs. Slocombe have been chosen to be made into life-size [[model (person)|models]] to represent the average man and woman in the street. Guest starring [[Ferdy Mayne]].
Filmed: 7 April 1977 '''Mr. Grainger retires''' ''(Arthur Brough's wife died on Easter Sunday, 26th March 1978, and [[Arthur Brough#Are You Being Served?|Brough himself died]] two months later on 28th May 1978.)'' | LineColor = ED9121 }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 6 (1978)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#00AC53 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 35 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = By Appointment | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1978|11|15|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The staff return from their holidays, and Mr. Tebbs has replaced Mr. Grainger as Head of Men's Wear. After Captain Peacock returns sounding like [[Donald Duck]] and Mr Lucas with burnt feet, the staff are soon told that [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom|the Queen]] and [[Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh|the Duke of Edinburgh]] are making an official visit to the borough, and they might be coming to Grace Brothers. The staff rehearse what to do if the Royal couple visit and on the day they all dress up in their finery and then watch them in the street below from Mr. Rumbold's office window. Unfortunately, just as it appears the Queen and Prince Philip might be about to enter the store, Mrs. Slocombe accidentally knocks a plant pot off the window ledge which narrowly misses the Royal couple, who get back in their car and speed away from the scene as quickly as possible!
Filmed: 29 October 1978
'''First appearance of Mr. Tebbs''' | LineColor = 00AC53 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 36 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = The Club | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1978|11|22|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The staff are offered a room in the basement that they can turn into a social club. Young Mr. Grace says he will spend up to £300 on decorating it, but when the decorators give their estimate as £500, the staff offer to do the job themselves and pocket £50 each. However, the job soon proves more difficult than they first thought. Guest starring [[Mavis Pugh]].
Filmed: 5 November 1978 | LineColor = 00AC53 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 37 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = Do You Take This Man? | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1978|11|29|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mrs. Slocombe becomes engaged to a [[Greece|Greek]] man called Mr. Metaxas, and her wealthy American uncle Wendal P. Clark (played by [[Norman Mitchell]]) has offered to pay for the reception and will buy the couple a house as a wedding present. However, on the morning of the wedding, the [[best man]] ([[Gorden Kaye]]) brings bad news: The groom is already married, and his wife has demanded that he return home to Greece. The staff, hoping to help Mrs. Slocombe, decide to fake the wedding ceremony right in the store, with Mr. Humphries as the "groom" and Mr. Tebbs playing a [[Greek Orthodox Church|Greek Orthodox]] priest. Guest starring [[Felix Bowness]].
Filmed: 12 November 1978 | LineColor = 00AC53 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 38 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = Shedding the Load | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1978|12|6|df=y}} | ShortSummary = After continuing falling sales, it is decided that one of the floor staff will have to be made [[Redundancy (law)|redundant]] and the management decide to let the staff decide which of them it will be. After a secret ballot, which results in everyone except Mr. Humphries getting one vote, the staff gather at the store on the weekend to battle it out. However, Young Mr. Grace announces that the cutbacks have been cancelled and that he is giving himself a three-day week instead.
Filmed: 19 November 1978 | LineColor = 00AC53 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 39 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = A Bliss Girl | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1978|12|13|df=y}} | ShortSummary = A stall to sell "Bliss" perfume has arrived on the floor, but because of the thick [[fog]], the Bliss salesgirl has not arrived. It is then decided that Mr. Humphries should sell the perfume instead so he is then made to staff the stall. This means that the Menswear Department is undermanned, so Mr. Rumbold orders a furious Captain Peacock to work the menswear counter instead of Mr Humphries. Guest starring [[Jan Holden]] and [[Bernice Adams]].
Filmed: 26 November 1978 | LineColor = 00AC53 }} }}</onlyinclude>
====Christmas special (1978)==== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#00FF00 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 40 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | Title = Happy Returns | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1978|12|26|df=y}} | ShortSummary = It is Young Mr. Grace's birthday, and the staff sing the traditional birthday song for him and enjoy the traditional free lunch. They later rehearse their [[cabaret]] performance for Young Mr. Grace's birthday party, a [[ballet]] called ''The Ballet of the Toys''. A professional cabaret troupe will also be performing at the party, and when the troupe arrives, it turns out they themselves will be performing ''The Ballet of the Toys'', which forces the staff to go to Plan B.
Filmed: 3 December 1978 '''Last appearance of Mr. Tebbs''' | LineColor = 00FF00 }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 7 (1979)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#F984E5 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 41 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = The Junior | DirectedBy = David Croft | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1979|10|19|df=y}} | ShortSummary = When Mr. Tebbs retires, Mr. Humphries and Mr. Lucas are both promoted, so Mr. Rumbold and Young Mr. Grace advertise for candidates for the junior position. After an applicant that lives in a packing case in [[Covent Garden]] and another that Mr Humphries dislikes the staff decide to go home. Suddenly, Mr Goldberg, a gifted salesman with an endearing personality, immediately makes himself popular with all the staff, except with Captain Peacock, whom Mr. Goldberg says he used to know.
Filmed: 16 September 1979
'''First appearance of Mr. Goldberg''' | LineColor = F984E5 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 42 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = Strong Stuff This Insurance | DirectedBy = Gordon Elsbury | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1979|10|26|df=y}} | ShortSummary =The staff gets the opportunity to participate in a lucrative group [[insurance]] scheme that will land them all sizable pensions upon [[retirement]]. Unfortunately, they must first pass through a physical examination. In an effort to shape up without spending too much money, Mr. Humphries enlists his former [[ballet]] instructor. After their physicals, they retreat to Young Mr. Grace's office to learn the results, and what they hear shocks them. Guest starring [[Amanda Barrie]] and [[Joy Allen]].
Filmed: 23 September 1979 | LineColor = F984E5 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 43 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = The Apartment | DirectedBy = David Croft & Gordon Elsbury | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1979|11|2|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mrs. Slocombe is rendered temporarily homeless after squatters invade her new flat. After her co-workers fail to provide accommodation, Young Mr. Grace allows her to move into the store's Furniture Fitting Department on the top floor. Mrs. Slocombe turns the floor into a cosy home-from-home, but her space is soon invaded when a transport strike forces the rest of the staff to move in too. Guest starring [[Jeffrey Holland]]. Filmed: 30 September 1979 | LineColor = F984E5 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 44 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = Mrs. Slocombe, Senior Person | DirectedBy = Gordon Elsbury | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1979|11|9|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr. Rumbold is taken ill because of food poisoning and Young Mr. Grace appoints Mrs. Slocombe to take his place temporarily . Clearly relishing her new role, Mrs. Slocombe holes up in Mr. Rumbold's office, descending to the commoners only to flaunt her executive status. However, when sales in the Ladies' Department begin to skyrocket in her absence, Mrs. Slocombe fears that she'll be given the boot once Mr. Rumbold gets back. A homemade meringue in Mr. Rumbold's desk, however, changes everything. Guest starring [[Avril Angers]] and [[Gorden Kaye]]. One of the longest takes in the series occurs when Mrs Slocombe settles into Rumbold's office. It is three minutes and twelve seconds long.
Filmed: 6 October 1979
'''Note''': This was the favourite episode of [[Mollie Sugden]] and repeated on 18 July 2009 as part of a tribute two weeks after her death on 1 July. | LineColor = F984E5 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 45 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = The Hero | DirectedBy = Gordon Elsbury | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1979|11|16|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr. Franco of the Sports Department uncovers an embarrassing secret about Captain Peacock and spreads gossip among the entire department store. To save face, Captain Peacock's colleagues urge him to challenge Franco to a [[boxing]] match. At the last minute, however, Captain Peacock withdraws and Mr. Humphries steps in to defend Captain Peacock's honour — in a hastily improvised [[professional wrestling|wrestling]] match. After a terrifying match, Mrs Slocombe saves the day. Guest starring [[Jackie Pallo]].
Filmed: 13 October 1979 | LineColor = F984E5 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 46 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | Title = Anything You Can Do | DirectedBy = Gordon Elsbury | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1979|11|23|df=y}} | ShortSummary = After the staff complain once too often about the food and service in the canteen, the caterers issue an ultimatum: present them with a written apology or staff the canteen themselves. To preserve their dignity, they choose the latter option, but very quickly find the subtle art of cookery quite challenging.
Filmed: 20 October 1979 | LineColor = F984E5 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 47 | EpisodeNumber2 = 7 | Title = The Agent | DirectedBy = Gordon Elsbury | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1979|11|30|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr. Goldberg is running a lucrative side business recruiting his colleagues for higher-paid sales positions in competing department stores. When Mr. Humphries and Mrs. Slocombe receive offers for the job of their dreams, Mr. Rumbold and Captain Peacock struggle to find a way to make them stay, without actually giving them rises. Guest starring [[Jeffrey Segal]].
Filmed: 27 October 1979 | LineColor = F984E5 }} }}</onlyinclude>
====Christmas special (1979)==== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#00FF00 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 48 | EpisodeNumber2 = 8 | Title = The Punch and Judy Affair | DirectedBy = David Croft | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1979|12|26|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The Gentlemen's and Ladies' departments become pariahs when they choose not to take part in a company-wide strike. In an attempt to regain favour, the departments stage a life-sized [[Punch and Judy]] show to entertain everyone. Mr. Humphries directs, Mr. Lucas and Miss Brahms play the title roles, Captain Peacock plays [[The Devil]], Mr Goldberg plays the red cheeked butcher and Mrs. Slocombe brings convincing masculinity to the role of policewoman.
'''Last appearance of Mr. Lucas, Mr. Goldberg and Miss Bakewell''' | LineColor = 00FF00 }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 8 (1981)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#01645C |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 49 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = Is It Catching? | DirectedBy = John Kilby | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1981|4|9|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr. Goldberg and Mr. Lucas are replaced by Mr. Grossman and Mr. Spooner, and Young Mr. Grace steps down, handing over the reins to his older brother, Old Mr. Grace. Meanwhile, Mr. Humphries contracts a rare tropical malady known as "Marine's Disease", and the entire staff are [[quarantined]] in the basement to prevent the infection from spreading. Guest starring [[John D. Collins]].
Filmed: 3 April 1981
'''First appearance of Mr. Grossman, Mr. Spooner and Old Mr. Grace''' | LineColor = 01645C }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 50 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = A Personal Problem | DirectedBy = John Kilby | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1981|4|16|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Captain Peacock's marriage is on the rocks again, but this time, it is Mrs. Peacock who is guilty of philandering. After Mrs Peacock starts work as Mr Rumbold's new secretary, the cuckolded Captain Peacock suspects his wife's mysterious lover is none other than Mr. Rumbold, he goes to great lengths to make sure he catches them in the act. Guest starring [[Jack Haig (actor)|Jack Haig]].
Filmed: 10 April 1981 | LineColor = 01645C }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 51 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = Front Page Story | DirectedBy = John Kilby | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1981|4|23|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Old Mr. Grace decides to publish an in-store magazine and appoints Mr. Humphries as its editor. Mr. Humphries finds himself up to his neck with the gossip column, but his greatest challenge proves to be ensuring the staff bonuses by orchestrating a beauty contest with Miss Brahms as the ringer. When Miss Brahms refuses, Mrs. Slocombe "sacrifices herself for the sake of the department" and fills in, but ironically it's Mr. Humphries (as Miss Do-It-Yourself) who takes first place: he wins a weeks holiday on Old Mr. Grace's yacht, much to his displeasure.
Filmed: 17 April 1981 | LineColor = 01645C }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 52 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = Sit Out | DirectedBy = John Kilby | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1981|4|30|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Sales at Grace Brothers are getting incredibly low, so Old Mr Grace decides to either cut the staff's wages by 10%, or move them into the bargain basement. The staff are so annoyed, they come into work late and hold a roof top protest. After failing to write a slogan on the wall of the store, their protest is quickly cut short as a fire breaks out in the store.
Filmed: 24 April 1981
'''Last appearance of Mr. Grossman''' | LineColor = 01645C }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 53 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = Heir Apparent | DirectedBy = John Kilby | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1981|5|7|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr Klein takes over from Mr Grossman as head of the menswear department. After seeing an old photograph of Mr. Humphries's mother, Old Mr. Grace thinks that Mr. Humphries may be his long lost son and heir to the store, so Mr. Humphries' mother (played by [[John Inman]]) is called in to settle the matter once and for all.
Filmed: 1 May 1981
'''First appearance of Mr. Klein''' | LineColor = 01645C }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 54 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | Title = Closed Circuit | DirectedBy = John Kilby | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1981|5|21|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Grace Brothers decides to advertise on television and while Miss Brahms is the face of the advert, Old Mr. Grace's nurse is the voice. When the wealthy Lord Hirly, sees the advert, he falls in love with the voice, which means that when he invites Miss Brahms out to dinner, she and the staff have to attempt to make him believe that Miss Brahms has the nurse's voice. Their plan is short lived after Old Mr Grace and his nurse arrive at the restaurant. Guest starring [[Gorden Kaye]] and [[John D. Collins]].
Filmed: 8 May 1981 | LineColor = 01645C }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 55 | EpisodeNumber2 = 7 | Title = The Erotic Dreams of Mrs. Slocombe | DirectedBy = John Kilby | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1981|5|28|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mrs. Slocombe is repeatedly having erotic dreams about Mr Humphries and becomes increasingly fond of him, and showers him with presents. The obsession soon drives her to alcoholism, and it is decided that to cure her Mr. Humphries must show her attention when they attend a ballet concert that night. Guest starring [[Jack Haig (actor)|Jack Haig]] and [[Rusty Goffe]].
Filmed: 15 May 1981 | LineColor = 01645C }} }}</onlyinclude>
====Christmas special (1981)==== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#00FF00 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 56 | EpisodeNumber2 = 8 | Title = Roots? | DirectedBy = John Kilby | WrittenBy = David Croft & Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1981|12|24|df=y}} | ShortSummary = It is Old Mr Grace's birthday, and the department want to bring a musical tribute to the Grace family. Mr Rumbold's brother Mycroft (also played by [[Nicholas Smith (actor)|Nicholas Smith]] in a double role) then sets out to trace the Grace family tree, which leads to Wales, Scotland, [[Somerset]] and, ultimately (apparently), deepest Africa.
'''Last appearance of Young Mr Grace, Old Mr Grace, Mr Klein and the Nurse''' | LineColor = 00FF00 }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 9 (1983)=== Note: David Croft did return for the final read through and added additional material to the scripts.
<onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#FB6900 |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 57 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = The Sweet Smell of Success | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1983|4|22|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mrs. Slocombe decides to sell her home-made perfume to increase sales. It has to happen under the counter since Mr. Rumbold would never approve of this, and what is more, the perfume seems to have some quite extraordinary qualities. Unfortunately, one of them involves threatening the Peacocks' already fragile marriage.
Filmed: 8 April 1983
'''First appearance of Miss. Belfridge ''' | LineColor = FB6900 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 58 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = Conduct Unbecoming | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1983|4|29|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr. Humphries is becoming frequently late for work, and it is soon revealed that an argument with his mother has forced him to move out. When money then goes missing from the till, Mr. Humphries is accused of theft and Grace Brothers put him on trial. With Captain Peacock acting as the prosecutor, Mrs. Slocombe as Mr. Humphries' defender, and Miss Belfridge being removed from the jury for being "biased", it's a trial to remember. Mr. Humphries is found guilty and forced to resign, much to everyone's dismay. However, the missing money turns up at the back of the till, exonerating Mr. Humphries. To add to his sudden fortune, he makes up with his mother.
Filmed: 14 April 1983 | LineColor = FB6900 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 59 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = Memories Are Made of This | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1983|5|6|df=y}} | ShortSummary = After all of his department are ill, Mr Walpole of the sports department is temporarily working on Mr Rumbold's floor. Mrs. Slocombe loses her memory after being hit on the head with a golf ball. She thinks that she is a little girl and it is indeed hard for the rest of staff, who want to hide her behaviour from Mr. Rumbold at all costs. By day's end, Mrs. Slocombe regains her memory and gets one of the in-stock fur coats as a peace offering. It turns out that she only lost her memory for a moment, but had faked the rest so that she could get her coat. Guest starring [[Ballard Berkeley]] and [[Jess Conrad]].
Filmed: 22 April 1983 | LineColor = FB6900 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 60 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = Calling All Customers | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1983|5|13|df=y}} | ShortSummary = For Grace Brothers, there may be a market in advertising on [[Citizens' band radio|CB radio]]. The staff are asked to perform a radio show but they cannot agree on the plot. Mr. Harman's countryside tale is chosen instead, and the staff get to work on rehearsals. To their horror, the rehearsals accidentally get broadcast across London, prompting censorship threats and the wrong type of people coming to Grace Brothers. Guest starring [[Nosher Powell]] and [[Ron Tarr]], with voices of [[Vicki Michelle]] and [[Robbie Coltrane]].
Filmed: 29 April 1983 | LineColor = FB6900 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 61 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = Monkey Business | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1983|5|20|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The staff had been promised a large pay-rise, but when they hear that they are not going to get it, they decide to go to 10 Downing Street to protest to the [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]]. Meanwhile, a monkey has escaped from the Pet Department and is hiding in the lift shaft. Guest starring [[John D. Collins]] and [[Jan Ravens]].
Filmed: 6 May 1983 | LineColor = FB6900 }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 62 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | Title = Lost and Found | DirectedBy = Bob Spiers | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1983|5|27|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mrs. Slocombe's pet cat, Tiddles, has gone missing. Knowing how much she cared for the cat and fearing the worst, the staff decide to buy Mrs. Slocombe a kitten. Mr. Humphries is set to make the presentation, but Mrs. Slocombe misinterprets it as a marriage proposal and accepts, to the shock of everyone. Guest starring [[Norman Mitchell]].
Filmed: 13 May 1983 | LineColor = FB6900 }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Series 10 (1985)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#B77FDF |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 63 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = Goodbye Mrs. Slocombe | DirectedBy = Martin Shardlow | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1985|2|18|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Staff above a certain age are to be made redundant, and this applies to Mrs. Slocombe. She refuses to leave Grace Brothers and becomes a cleaner. The staff want to get her back on the floor at all costs, especially when they discover she is to be replaced with the more-than-annoying Miss Featherstone. Fortunately, Mr. Humphries comes to the rescue as only he can, dressing up as an annoying female customer, prompting Miss Featherstone to leave. Mrs. Slocombe is reinstated but new regulations force Captain Peacock and Mr. Rumbold into lower positions.
Filmed: 15 June 1984 | LineColor = B77FDF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 64 | EpisodeNumber2 = 2 | Title = Grounds For Divorce | DirectedBy = Martin Shardlow | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1985|2|25|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Captain Peacock has serious marital trouble. Miss Bagnold is completely infatuated with him and when she joins the Grace Brothers Accounts Department and Captain Peacock soon finds his position unbearable. He must choose whether that he will stay with Mrs. Peacock or not, and is prepared to go to extreme measures to solve his problems.
Filmed: 22 June 1984 | LineColor = B77FDF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 65 | EpisodeNumber2 = 3 | Title = The Hold Up | DirectedBy = Martin Shardlow | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1985|3|4|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The staff stay in late for stocktaking, but two robbers infiltrate the building and take Miss Brahms hostage. Captain Peacock and Mr. Spooner pretend to be police officers, but the robbers do not believe them. The only thing the robbers are afraid of is the vicious Gumby Gang, so Mr. Harman, Mrs. Slocombe and Mr. Humphries pretend to be Pa Gumby, Mad Ma Gumby and their son, Italian Tony so they can rescue Miss Brahms, Captain Peacock and Mr Spooner.
Filmed: 29 June 1984 | LineColor = B77FDF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 66 | EpisodeNumber2 = 4 | Title = Gambling Fever | DirectedBy = Martin Shardlow | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1985|3|11|df=y}} | ShortSummary = The staff are finally paid their long-expected bonuses. When Mr. Harman tells them he knows of a horse that absolutely cannot lose that afternoon's race, they all bet their £100 bonuses on the horse. They want to watch the race on the television in Mr. Rumbold's office, but he catches them and throws them out. Mr. Harman tells them that they have lost their bonuses, but they can win them back by betting on another horse.
Filmed: 6 July 1984 | LineColor = B77FDF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 67 | EpisodeNumber2 = 5 | Title = The Night Club | DirectedBy = Martin Shardlow | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1985|3|18|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Mr. Grace gives the staff permission to use the department floor after hours to make more money for the store. It is soon decided to set up a night club with food and music. Mr. Humphries has a friend in the local cinema who will broadcast a promotional commercial for the "Club Rendezvous". But when the staff are all at the cinema (which shows films of questionable taste) and the film is about to be broadcast, there are some technical problems and the promotion is reduced to sound-only.
Filmed: 13 July 1984 | LineColor = B77FDF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 68 | EpisodeNumber2 = 6 | Title = Friends and Neighbours | DirectedBy = Martin Shardlow | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1985|3|25|df=y}} | ShortSummary = In response to the staff's complaints about rising transportation costs, Mr. Grace offers the overnight use of some penthouse apartments above the store. However, the staff's patience with each other is pushed to its limit when they have to live together as well as work together, especially when Captain Peacock tries to bring Miss Belfridge along. Crying babies, a hideaway bed, plastic flowers and a beanbag all add to the misery.
Filmed: 20 July 1984 | LineColor = B77FDF }} {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 69 | EpisodeNumber2 = 7 | Title = The Pop Star | DirectedBy = Martin Shardlow | WrittenBy = Jeremy Lloyd | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|1985|4|1|df=y}} | ShortSummary = Just when it looks like his career at Grace Brothers is finished, the perennially tardy Mr. Spooner finds the rest of the staff competing for his favour after a record company offers him a contract after a brilliant performance at the Department Store Annual Concert. They are all jockeying for parts as backing singers, but are worried that Mr. Spooner's voice will not hold out. On the local television show, their fears are confirmed, resulting in a finale filled with lip-synching and faulty sound equipment.
Filmed: 27 July 1984 '''Last appearance of Mr Spooner and Miss Belfridge''' | LineColor = B77FDF }} }}</onlyinclude>
===Special (2016)=== <onlyinclude>{{Episode table |background=#73C2FB |overall=5 |season=5 |title=20 |director=18 |writer=27 |airdate=15 |viewers= |country=UK |viewersR=<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.barb.co.uk/whats-new/weekly-top-30|title=Weekly Viewing Summary (see relevant week)|publisher=[[BARB]]}}</ref> |episodes= {{Episode list/sublist|List of Are You Being Served? episodes | EpisodeNumber = 70 | EpisodeNumber2 = 1 | Title = You Can't Teach a New Dog Old Tricks | RTitle = <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b07tlqw3|title=You Can't Teach a New Dog Old Tricks, Are You Being Served?|website=BBC}}</ref> | DirectedBy = Dewi Humphreys | WrittenBy = [[Derren Litten]] | OriginalAirDate = {{Start date|2016|8|28|df=y}} | Viewers = 6.56 | ShortSummary = It's 1988 and Mr Grace is determined to drag Grace Brothers into, well 1988, but he has a problem on his hands. Mr Humphries, Captain Peacock, Mr Rumbold, Mr Grainger (who has come out of retirement to spend less time with his wife) and Mrs Slocombe all seem to be stuck in another era. A new member of staff, Mr Conway, joins the team - but will he help shake things up or will he just put a pussy among the pigeons?
Filmed: 5 March 2016
'''First appearance of Mr Conway, Mr Grace and Miss Croft'''
'''Note: This episode marks the return of Mr Grainger''' | LineColor = 73C2FB }} }}</onlyinclude>
==References== {{Reflist}}
==Bibliography== * Richard Webber, "I'm Free! – The Complete Are You Being Served?", Orion Books, 1999
